page.title: 10MARYKIRK CHURCH 1
page.content: Marykirk Presbyterian Church is in the parish of Aberluthnot. Trees grow around the church. It has big windows and inside, at the front, is the pulpit which used to be on another wall but now covers a lovely window. Upstairs, is the church hall which is 5 years old. There used to be a gallery where the hall is. There is another room where the Sunday School meets, a meeting room and a toilet. The Church is about 200 years old. The very first minister in 1474 was John Chalmers, a Roman Catholic. Now you can see the ruins of the first church in the old graveyard. On the way to Luthermuir, there is a new cemetry. Luthermuir is also part of the parish. The present minister is Mr Blaikie.
